Contacts REST API documentation¶

Add your content using reStructuredText syntax. See the reStructuredText documentation for details.

REST API main¶

main.health_check()¶

Health check endpoint to verify if the API is up and running.

Returns:

A JSON response indicating the API status.

Return type:

dict

async main.read_root()¶

Root endpoint for the FastAPI application.

Returns:

A JSON response indicating the API status.

Return type:

dict

async main.startup()¶

Initialize Redis and FastAPILimiter during the startup event.

Return type:

None

REST API repository Contacts¶

Contacts Repository Module

This module provides functions for handling contacts in the database.

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactCreate, user: User, db: Session) → Contact¶

The function creates a new contact for a provided user.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactCreate) – Contact’s data.

  • user (User) – To create a contact for a specified user.

  • db (Session) – A database session.

Returns:

A created contact.

Return type:

Contact

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Contact¶

The function returns a contact with a provided contact_id for a specified user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – A contact_id to return.

  • user (User) – To get a contact for a specified user.

  • db (Session) – A database session.

Returns:

A contact with a provided contact_id or None if a contact with a provided id doesn’t exist.

Return type:

Contact | None

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(skip: int, limit: int, user: User, db: Session) → List[Contact]¶

The function returns a list of contacts for a user with pagination param.

Parameters:

  • skip (int) – A number of contacts to skip.

  • limit (int) – A maximum contacts number to show.

  • user (User) – To get contacts for a specified user.

  • db (Session) – A database session.

Returns:

A list of contacts.

Return type:

List[Contact]

src.repository.contacts.get_upcoming_birthdays(db: Session, user: User, days: int = 7) → List[Contact]¶

The function returns contacts with upcoming birthdays within the specified number of days (7) for a provided user. :param db: A database session. :type db: Session :param user: To search for contacts’ upcoming birthdays of a specified user. :type user: User :param days: A number of days to search for upcoming birthdays (default is 7 days). :type days: int :return: A list of contacts who have birthdays in the upcoming days. :rtype: List[Contact]

async src.repository.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Contact | None¶

The function removes a contact with a provided id for a provided user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – A contact_id to remove.

  • user (User) – To remove a contact for a specified user.

  • db (Session) – A database session.

Returns:

A removed contact or None if a contact with a provided id doesn’t exist.

Return type:

Contact | None

async src.repository.contacts.search_contacts(db: Session, first_name: str | None, last_name: str | None, email: str | None, user: User) → List[Contact]¶

The function searches for contacts by a provided first name or last name or email.

Parameters:

  • db (Session) – A database session.

  • first_name (str) – Will be used to search among a first name of all the contacts of a specified user.

  • last_name (str) – Will be used to search among a last name of all the contacts of a specified user.

  • email (str) – Will be used to search among an email of all the contacts of a specified user.

  • user (User) – To search for contacts of a specified user.

Returns:

A list of the contacts with matches.

Return type:

List[Contact]

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactUpdate, user: User, db: Session) → Contact | None¶

The function updates contact info for a provided user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – A contact id to update.

  • body (ContactUpdate) – Updated contact’s data

  • user (User) – To update a contact for a specified user.

  • db (Session) – A database session.

Returns:

An updated contact or None if a contact with a provided id doesn’t exist.

Return type:

Contact | None

REST API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

The function confirms the email of a user.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email to confirm for a user.

  • db (Session) – A database session.

Returns:

None

Return type:

None

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session) → User¶

The function creates a new user and assigns a Gravatar image if available.

Parameters:

  • body (UserModel) – The user’s data.

  • db (Session) – A database session.

Returns:

A created user.

Return type:

User

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → User¶

The function returns a user by a provided email.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – An email to search for a user.

  • db (Session) – A database session.

Returns:

A user with the provided email or None if no user is found.

Return type:

User | None

async src.repository.users.update_avatar(email, url: str, db: Session) → User¶

The function updates the avatar URL for a user by their email.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email of the user to update the avatar for.

  • url (str) – The new avatar URL.

  • db (Session) – A database session.

Returns:

The updated user.

Return type:

User

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: Session) → None¶

The function updates the refresh token for a provided user.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – The user to update the token for.

  • token (str | None) – A new refresh token or None to remove it.

  • db (Session) – A database session.

Returns:

None

Return type:

None

REST API routes Contacts¶

async src.routes.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactCreate, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The function creates a new contact for the current user.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactCreate) – The contact’s creation data.

  • db (Session) – A database session.

  • current_user (User) – The current authenticated user.

Returns:

The newly created contact.

Return type:

ContactResponse

async src.routes.contacts.get_upcoming_birthdays(days: int = Query(7), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The function returns contacts with upcoming birthdays within the specified number of days.

Parameters:

  • days (int) – Number of days to look ahead for upcoming birthdays (default is 7 days).

  • db (Session) – A database session.

  • current_user (User) – The current authenticated user.

Returns:

A list of contacts with upcoming birthdays.

Return type:

List[ContactResponse]

async src.routes.contacts.read_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The function returns a contact by ID for the current user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The contact ID to retrieve.

  • db (Session) – A database session.

  • current_user (User) – The current authenticated user.

Returns:

The contact with the provided contact ID or raises HTTP 404 if not found.

Return type:

ContactResponse

async src.routes.contacts.read_contacts(skip: int = 0, limit: int = 100, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The function returns a paginated list of contacts for the current user.

Parameters:

  • skip (int) – The number of contacts to skip.

  • limit (int) – The maximum number of contacts to return.

  • db (Session) – A database session.

  • current_user (User) – The current authenticated user.

Returns:

A list of contacts.

Return type:

List[ContactResponse]

async src.routes.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The function removes a contact by ID for the current user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The contact ID to remove.

  • db (Session) – A database session.

  • current_user (User) – The current authenticated user.

Returns:

The removed contact or raises HTTP 404 if not found.

Return type:

ContactResponse

async src.routes.contacts.search_contacts(first_name: str | None = Query(None), last_name: str | None = Query(None), email: str | None = Query(None), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The function searches for contacts by first name, last name, or email for the current user.

Parameters:

  • first_name (str | None) – First name to search.

  • last_name (str | None) – Last name to search.

  • email (str | None) – Email to search.

  • db (Session) – A database session.

  • current_user (User) – The current authenticated user.

Returns:

A list of contacts matching the search criteria.

Return type:

List[ContactResponse]

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactUpdate, contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The function updates an existing contact by ID for the current user.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactUpdate) – The updated contact data.

  • contact_id (int) – The contact ID to update.

  • db (Session) – A database session.

  • current_user (User) – The current authenticated user.

Returns:

The updated contact or raises HTTP 404 if not found.

Return type:

ContactResponse

REST API routes Users¶

async src.routes.users.read_users_me(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The function returns the current authenticated user’s information.

Parameters:

current_user (User) – The current authenticated user.

Returns:

The current user’s details.

Return type:

UserDb

async src.routes.users.update_avatar_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The function updates the current user’s avatar by uploading a new image to Cloudinary.

Parameters:

  • file (UploadFile) – The uploaded avatar file.

  • current_user (User) – The current authenticated user.

  • db (Session) – A database session.

Returns:

The updated user information with the new avatar URL.

Return type:

UserDb

REST API routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Confirms a user’s email using a token sent via email.

Parameters:

  • token (str) – The token sent to the user’s email.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

A message confirming the email.

Return type:

dict

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(NoneType), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Authenticates a user and returns an access token and refresh token.

Parameters:

  • body (OAuth2PasswordRequestForm) – The login credentials (username and password).

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

Access and refresh tokens.

Return type:

dict

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Refreshes an access token using the provided refresh token.

Parameters:

  • credentials (HTTPAuthorizationCredentials) – The refresh token credentials.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

New access and refresh tokens.

Return type:

dict

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Resends the confirmation email to the user.

Parameters:

  • body (RequestEmail) – The request body containing the user’s email.

  • background_tasks (BackgroundTasks) – FastAPI background tasks for sending the email.

  • request (Request) – The current request to extract the base URL for the email link.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

A message indicating that the email has been resent.

Return type:

dict

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserModel, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Registers a new user, hashes their password, and sends a confirmation email.

Parameters:

  • body (UserModel) – User information for signup.

  • background_tasks (BackgroundTasks) – FastAPI background tasks for email sending.

  • request (Request) – The current request to extract the base URL for the email link.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

A message confirming user creation and email sent.

Return type:

dict

REST API service Auth¶

class src.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

Auth class handles password hashing, JWT token generation, decoding, and user authentication.

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = 'secret_key'¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

Generates a new access token.

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – The data to encode in the token.

  • expires_delta (Optional[float]) – The expiration time in seconds, defaults to 15 minutes.

Returns:

The encoded JWT access token.

Return type:

str

create_email_token(data: dict)¶

Generates a token for email confirmation.

Parameters:

data (dict) – The data to encode in the token.

Returns:

The encoded email confirmation token.

Return type:

str

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

Generates a new refresh token.

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – The data to encode in the token.

  • expires_delta (Optional[float]) – The expiration time in seconds, defaults to 7 days.

Returns:

The encoded JWT refresh token.

Return type:

str

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶

Decodes a refresh token and extracts the email (subject) if valid.

Parameters:

refresh_token (str) – The refresh token to decode.

Returns:

The email from the decoded token.

Return type:

str

Raises:

HTTPException – If the token is invalid or has an invalid scope.

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Gets the current authenticated user based on the access token.

Parameters:

  • token (str) – The JWT token from the OAuth2 scheme.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The current authenticated user.

Return type:

User

Raises:

HTTPException – If credentials are invalid or user is not found.

async get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

Extracts the email from an email confirmation token.

Parameters:

token (str) – The email confirmation token.

Returns:

The email extracted from the token.

Return type:

str

Raises:

HTTPException – If the token is invalid or cannot be decoded.

get_password_hash(password: str)¶

Hashes a plain password using bcrypt.

Parameters:

password (str) – The plain password to hash.

Returns:

The hashed password.

Return type:

str

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
r = <redis.client.Redis(<redis.connection.ConnectionPool(<redis.connection.Connection(host=localhost,port=6379,db=0)>)>)>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶

Verifies a plain password against its hashed version.

Parameters:

  • plain_password (str) – The plain password to verify.

  • hashed_password (str) – The hashed password to compare.

Returns:

True if the password matches, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

REST API service Email¶

async src.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶

Sends an email to the user for email confirmation with a token.

Parameters:

  • email (EmailStr) – The recipient’s email address.

  • username (str) – The recipient’s username to personalize the email.

  • host (str) – The host address to be included in the confirmation link.

Raises:

ConnectionErrors – If there is an issue with the email connection.

Return type:

None
